title: Easy Kimchi
summary: You can never have too many side dish recipes, so give Easy Kimchi a try. One portion of this dish contains about 39g of protein, 8g of fat, and a total of 811 calories. This recipe serves 1 and costs $8.14 per serving. It is an expensive recipe for fans of Korean food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 2 hours and 20 minutes. This recipe from bapstory.blogspot.com has 38 fans. It is a good option if you're following a dairy free and pescatarian diet. Head to the store and pick up green onions, sugar, korean fish sauce, and a few other things to make it today. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 97%. This score is spectacular. Similar recipes are Super Easy Kimchi Pancakes with Soy Dipping Sauce, Stir fried Kimchi and Rice (Kimchi Bokkeumbap), and Steamed Kimchi Dumplings (Jjin Kimchi Mandu).

winePairing.pairingText: Chenin Blanc, Gewurztraminer, and Riesling are my top picks for Korean. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. You could try Beaumont Hope Marguerite Chenin Blanc. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Beaumont Hope Marguerite Chenin Blanc
productMatches.description: Fresh, clean and powerful fruit.Matches brilliantly with seafood especially scallops and any beautifully spicy Asian dish.
